title: Buyers with clear vision sought for The Optical Company
text:
Auction time for a company is always a period when potential buyers want 2020 vision, peering through the spin to see if the fundamentals of the business on the block stack up.

And never was that more true than in the case of Miles Advisory's sale of The Optical Company, a vertically integrated optical group that owns eyecare centres around Australia.

The Optical Company is looking for a partner to help fund its growth ambitions. Supplied

Street Talk understands the business – which generates $5 to $6 million in earnings – is looking for a capital partner to underpin its growth ambitions and is in the early stages of an auction.

A teaser document is in circulation and prospective buyers have been signed up to non-disclosure agreements. Formal sale documents are expected to follow.

Miles Advisory will preside over a two-stage auction, with a signed deal targeted for early next year.
description: Miles Advisory is helping The Optical Company in its search for a growth capital partner.
